DOC.brief_summary: Less oxidative stress occurs during off-pump than on-pump coronary artery bypass graft (CABG) surgery but warm ischaemia-reperfusion injury may occur following transient coronary artery clamping. The aim of this study was to compare the preventive effects of diltiazem and N-acetylcysteine (NAC), alone or in combination, on biomarkers of myocardial damage and oxidative stress during off-pump CABG surgery.
DOC.brief_title: Ischaemia-réperfusion During the Coronary Surgery With Beating Heart
DOC.criteria: Age included between 60 and 80 years Age < 60 or > 80 years Pregnancy The allergy in used medicines (Nacétylcystéine, Diltiazem) Presence of a pathology valvulaire associated Urgency Unstable angor Bypass as a matter of urgency Recours peropératoire to a CEC FE < 0,40 BAV of the 2nd and 3rd not sailed degree fibrillation or flutter little finger.
